who was at that press conference in

to have a statement like this and what

this particular wing of the Chinese

to get in front of this problem and

they're all going through a

any suggestion from them
Celia that the military could intervene
the Chinese military
mm that was the one question that was
asked that was quickly batted away and
really it that the the spokes people
want to deal with that issue yes they
they did something that the the the
Chinese Ministry of Defense did last

inform reporters that they needed to go
and look at the relevant law on the

outlined in Hong Kong now they're
referring to article 14 of the Hong Kong
Basic Law which says that yes the
Chinese military can intervene in Hong
Kong in instances of natural disaster
and social unrest it's quite a vague law
and that's all the spokespeople today
would say but they clearly did not want
to discuss that they they were much more
eager to talk about how Hong Kong could
prosper economically if it was only
stable if the small number of radical
protesters were were put under control
that was something they had a lot of
time to deal with but they didn't want
to talk about military intervention so
see there in that sense were there quite
a few of carrots that were being offered
to the people of Hong Kong as well as a
few sticks that's right I mean there was
an interesting mixture of language at
this press conference because on the one
hand you could see that they wanted to
talk about you know the the prospect of
greater economic development they tried
to sound quite understanding at times
saying that they understood problems of
Hong Kong youth and in in dealing with
affordable housing in in getting
employment wanted to do more to help
those people who were who were unhappy
in Hong Kong that they recognized these
were problems but then they were also
very very quick to blame the so-called
radical protesters and how they were
being propped up by Western governments
they said that there were certain
individuals who had been very unhelpful
and that and that really that that some

good to see you thanks for joining us
